docs.snippet: BERN, Switzerland, June 26 -- Uruguay and Austria swept into the semi-final round of the world soccer championship today after two of the most thrilling matches the sport ever has seen.
docs.lead_paragraph: BERN, Switzerland, June 26 -- Uruguay and Austria swept into the semi-final round of the world soccer championship today after two of the most thrilling matches the sport ever has seen.

headline.main: Uruguay Puts Out England in Soccer; URUGUAY ELEVEN DEFEATS ENGLAND

docs.snippet: America's chess players in the international match with Russia that ended at the Hotel Roosevelt last Thursday, suffered a seemingly one-sided defeat 20 -- 12, but demonstrated in the fourth and final round that the visitors were not invincible.
docs.lead_paragraph: America's chess players in the international match with Russia that ended at the Hotel Roosevelt last Thursday, suffered a seemingly one-sided defeat 20 -- 12, but demonstrated in the fourth and final round that the visitors were not invincible.

headline.main: U .S. TEAM SHOWS METTLE IN CHESS; 4-4 Tie in Last Round After 3 Losses Consoles Hosts for Russians' Success

docs.snippet: BERN, Switzerland, June 27 (AP) -- A fight broke out between the Hungarian and Brazilian soccer teams in Bern's Wankdorf Stadium tonight after Hungary defeated Brazil, 4 -- 2, to enter the semi-final round of the world soccer championship.
docs.lead_paragraph: BERN, Switzerland, June 27 (AP) -- A fight broke out between the Hungarian and Brazilian soccer teams in Bern's Wankdorf Stadium tonight after Hungary defeated Brazil, 4 -- 2, to enter the semi-final round of the world soccer championship.
docs.abstract: World champ, Bern; Brazilian and Hungarian players in post-game fight; player, 3 policemen hurt; probe set

headline.main: Fighting Breaks Out as Hungary Eliminates Brazil in Soccer, 4-2; South American Player Slashed by Bottle and 3 Policemen Hurt in Locker-Room Brawl -- Germany Upsets Yugoslavia

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 28 -- The new Guatemalan regime of Col. Carlos Enrique Diaz pledged full cooperation today with the Inter-American Peace Committee's investigation of the fighting in Guatemala.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 28 -- The new Guatemalan regime of Col. Carlos Enrique Diaz pledged full cooperation today with the Inter-American Peace Committee's investigation of the fighting in Guatemala.

headline.main: Diaz Will Cooperate With Americas Unit; DIAZ PLEDGES AID TO AMERICAS UNIT

byline.original: By DANA ADAMS SCHMIDTSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WIMBLEDON, England, June 28 -- It was brains over brawn as those wandering veterans of the tennis wars, Jaroslav Drobny and Budge Patty, threw the seedings into confusion and the packed house into pandemonium with smashing triumphs over Lew Hoad of...
docs.lead_paragraph: WIMBLEDON, England, June 28 -- It was brains over brawn as those wandering veterans of the tennis wars, Jaroslav Drobny and Budge Patty, threw the seedings into confusion and the packed house into pandemonium with smashing triumphs over Lew Hoad of Australia and the defending champion, Vic Seixas of Philadelphia, in the all-England lawn tennis championships this bitterly cold afternoon.

headline.main: Drobny Defeats Hoad and Patty Eliminates Seixas in Wimbledon Upsets; TRABERT TOPPLES ROSE, 6-2, 6-2, 7-5 Rosewall, 5-Set Victor Over Hartwig, Also Gains, Along With Drobny and Patty

byline.original: By FRED TUPPERSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: BERN, Switzerland, June 28 (AP) -- International soccer officials today severely censured the Hungarian and Brazilian teams for their fist fighting yesterday. But they carefully avoided taking any action that might have hurt Hungary's chances against...
docs.lead_paragraph: BERN, Switzerland, June 28 (AP) -- International soccer officials today severely censured the Hungarian and Brazilian teams for their fist fighting yesterday. But they carefully avoided taking any action that might have hurt Hungary's chances against Uruguay on Wednesday in the semi-finals of the World Cup championship at Lausanne.

docs.snippet: ZURICH, June 30 (UP) -- Favored Hungary had to go into overtime to beat the defending champion, Uruguay, 4 to 2, and Germany crushed Austria, 6 to 1, in semi-final games in the World Cup Soccer football championships today.
docs.lead_paragraph: ZURICH, June 30 (UP) -- Favored Hungary had to go into overtime to beat the defending champion, Uruguay, 4 to 2, and Germany crushed Austria, 6 to 1, in semi-final games in the World Cup Soccer football championships today.

headline.main: Hungary, Germany Gain World Cup Soccer Final

docs.snippet: PEABODY, Mass., July 1 -After a two-year absence because of illness, Mrs. Mildred (Babe) Didrikson Zaharias came back today to try again for the women's United States open golf crown.
docs.lead_paragraph: PEABODY, Mass., July 1 -After a two-year absence because of illness, Mrs. Mildred (Babe) Didrikson Zaharias came back today to try again for the women's United States open golf crown.

headline.main: Mrs. Zaharias and Claire Doran Share 2-Stroke Lead in U. S. Open Golf; PACE-SETTERS GET 72'S TO EQUAL PAR Mrs. Zaharias, Miss Doran Head Field in U. S. Open -- Miss Wright at 74.

byline.original: By LINCOLN A. WERDENSpecial to The New York Times
